title: Simple Steps to Zoom Out in Adobe Illustrator

steps.title: Press and hold ⌘ Cmd++ (Mac) or Ctrl++ (Windows) to zoom in.
steps.content: Press and hold ⌘ Cmd + + (Mac) or Ctrl + + (Windows) to zoom in.

steps.title: Press and hold ⌘ Cmd+- (Mac) or Ctrl+- (Windows) to zoom out.
steps.content: Press and hold ⌘ Cmd + - (Mac) or Ctrl + - (Windows) to zoom out.

steps.title: Select the Zoom tool.
steps.content: Select the Zoom tool. The pointer becomes a magnifying glass with a plus sign in its center. You can also press Z on your keyboard. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click in the center of the area that you want to magnify.
steps.content: Click in the center of the area that you want to magnify.

steps.title: Hold down Alt (PC) or ⌥ Opt (Mac) and click in the center of the area that you want to reduce.
steps.content: Hold down Alt (PC) or ⌥ Opt (Mac) and click in the center of the area that you want to reduce. Depending on your "View with CPU/GPU" settings, you can also drag the mouse left or right to zoom in and out of areas of the canvas. If dragging only creates a small box, you can zoom into the highlighted box by releasing the mouse button.

steps.title: Go to View > Zoom In (or View) > Zoom Out.
steps.content: Go to View > Zoom In (or View) > Zoom Out . You'll see the View menu in the toolbar above your artboard.

steps.title: Set the zoom level using the zoom percentage menu.
steps.content: Set the zoom level using the zoom percentage menu. It's in the lower left corner of the window.
